hanzi-su-wiki:
僕

Значения

Я; слуга, прислужник

Мнемоника

Слуга 亻 с веником 業, обязанный подметать полы. Используется в качестве уничижительного местоимения «я», т.е. Ваш слуга.

Варианты

仆
purpleculture_pinyin:
pú
servant
слуга
rtega_mnemonic:
僕僕RS
仆仆		slave, servant, I
  • person 亻 boasting about himself when he used to be a slave carrying things through the thicket 菐
  • person 亻 subservient to the fortuneteller 卜
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 仆)
Antonyms: 主
Pictophonetic: 菐 (person) indicates the sound; 亻 conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
僕人 [ pú rén ]: servant
僕役 [ pú yì ]: servant
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 菐 [ pú ] thicket
heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. T has all sorts of servants, and one of them is responsible for a daily yoga session with him.
heisig_constituent: me, person, upside down in a row, husband
heisig_story: This key word is yet another synonym for "I," somewhat more familiar in tone. As a rule, it is a word that boys and men use to refer to themselves. Its elements: person . . . husbands . . . in a row upside down.
koohiiStory1: Mr. T also finds himself as one of the HUSBANDs, whose wives have had them hung UPSIDE DOWN IN A ROW. But when his wife comes up to punish him, he pleads, “It’s ME, Baby. I wasn’t behaving badly like these other foo’s.”.
koohiiStory2: Building on johnskb: Although it goes against the Heisig method, this story is a lot easier to remember when you know it´s the kanji for "boku." Males usually use either "boku" or "ore" (instead of "watashi") to refer themselves. "Boku" is slightly boyish and soft; "ore" is rough & tough. Mr. T would definitely use "ore" -- but when he´s one of the husbands hung upside down in a row about to be punished by his wife, he puts on a sweet act and switches to "boku" when he pleads "come on baby, it´s ME!".
jp_example_words:
僕(しもべ): manservant, servant (of God)
僕(ぼく): I (used by men with close acquaintances)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A leader of business? Ha! That's me! That's I!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: This version of I is more boyish. It's a sort of young man/boy way of saying "I," though you'll hear women use it too sometimes (it's a teensy bit tomboyish though).
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You use the word I a lot. You say it so much, you just start referring to yourself with the french beaucoup (ぼく) for a lot. Because you love yourself a lot.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: I am beaucoup I am. (Is that a pun? Did I do it right?) I dunno. Just say ぼく a lot and try to connect all of your approximate knowledges of languages together. Merci ぼく from ぼく.
Ru_Radicals: 化 (превращаться), 并, 王 (монарх), 羊 (овца)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the troublesome (菐) man (亻) is me
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T is a kind master and gives his servant a magic wand for his birthday.
humanum_full_description_en:
A bronze inscription from " its " (like a dustpan) from " Sim " (like instruments of torture) from " people " from the " tail (expressed in ◎)" from several points, such as hand-held bamboo Kei Sheng servant carrying garbage, sweep clean , The original meaning is slave, servant. " Qi " (Ji-shaped) was later transformed into " Zhe ", hands moved under the " Xin " shape, the human body changed to the left side, and the " Xin " shape became "丵" shape, "丵" and " servant " sound the same. It is the sound symbol of " servant ". The characters of the Warring States Period were written from the " Chen ", which has the same shape as the ancient characters of "Shuowen". Liu Xinglong believes that " tail " is insulting.

Oracle is used as the name of a person or place. Jinwen means servants, servants, against the clock: "Servants, servants (servants), servants and concubines." Also used as official name, Jingxi: "Wang Mingjing 𤔲 shoots the palace, and the boy submisses the servants to learn to shoot. ." It is also known as " attachment ", five years of Yan Shenggui: "Servant Yong Tutian", "Poetry. Lu Song.閟宫": "The mountains and rivers of tin, the vassals of Tutian". It is also used as a person's name, Shi Puhu: "Shi Puzha (as) a Zunhu."

Warring States bamboo " servant " as though through " Park ", "Guodian Jane. "Lao Zi Jia" Jane 2: "See Suo (Su) Guardian", the current edition of "Lao Zi" is "See Su Baopu".

"Said Wen": "Servant, giver. From the person to the 萐, the 萐 also sounds. Yu, the ancient text is from the minister." "Guang Yun. "House Rhyme": "Servant, attendant." "Book.冏明": "It serves the imperial servants, the bandits are righteous." The seventh of Bai Juyi's "Ten Ancient Poems Continued": "Many servants of the rich family".

See also " concubine ", " child ".
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " Qi " (like dustpan) from " Xin " (like torture instrument) from " person " from " tail " to count points (indicated by ◎), elephant servants hold bamboo pans to hold garbage and scour them to clean , The original meaning is slave, servant.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「其」(象簸箕)從「辛」(象刑具)從「人」從「尾」從數點(以◎表示)，象僕人手持竹箕盛載垃圾，灑掃清潔，本義是奴僕、僕人。「其」(箕形)後來訛變為「甾」，雙手移到「辛」形下方，人身變為左偏旁，「辛」形變成「丵」形，「丵」與「僕」音同，是「僕」的聲符。戰國文字從「臣」作，與《說文》古文同形。劉興隆認為從「尾」有侮辱之意。

　　甲骨文用作人名或地名。金文表示僕役、僕人，逆鐘：「僕庸(傭)臣妾小子。」又用作官名，靜簋：「王命靜𤔲射學宮，小子眔服眔小臣眔夷僕學射。」又通假作「附」，五年琱生簋：「僕庸土田」，《詩．魯頌．閟宮》：「錫之山川，土田附庸」。又用作人名，史僕壺：「史僕乍(作)尊壺。」

　　戰國竹簡「僕」通假作「樸」，《郭店簡．老子甲》簡2：「視索(素)保僕」，今本《老子》作「見素抱樸」。

　　《說文》：「僕，給事者。从人从菐，菐亦聲。䑑，古文从臣。」《廣韻．屋韻》：「僕，侍從人也。」《書．冏命》：「其侍御僕從，罔匪正人。」白居易〈續古詩十首〉之七：「豪家多婢僕」。

　　另參見「妾」、「童」。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「其」(象簸箕)從「辛」(象刑具)從「人」從「尾」從數點(以◎表示)，象僕人手持竹箕盛載垃圾，灑掃清潔，本義是奴僕、僕人。

僕(しもべ): manservant, servant (of God)
僕(ぼく): I (used by men with close acquaintances)

甲金文從「 其 」(象簸箕)從「 辛 」(象刑具)從「 人 」從「 尾 」從數點(以◎表示)，象僕人手持竹箕盛載垃圾，灑掃清潔，本義是奴僕、僕人。「 其 」(箕形)後來訛變為「 甾 」，雙手移到「 辛 」形下方，人身變為左偏旁，「 辛 」形變成「 丵 」形，「 丵 」與「 僕 」音同，是「 僕 」的聲符。戰國文字從「 臣 」作，與《說文》古文同形。劉興隆認為從「 尾 」有侮辱之意。 甲骨文用作人名或地名。金文表示僕役、僕人，逆鐘：「僕庸(傭)臣妾小子。」又用作官名，靜簋：「王命靜𤔲射學宮，小子眔服眔小臣眔夷僕學射。」又通假作「 附 」，五年琱生簋：「僕庸土田」，《詩．魯頌．閟宮》：「錫之山川，土田附庸」。又用作人名，史僕壺：「史僕乍(作)尊壺。」 戰國竹簡「 僕 」通假作「 樸 」，《郭店簡．老子甲》簡2：「視索(素)保僕」，今本《老子》作「見素抱樸」。 《說文》：「僕，給事者。从人从菐，菐亦聲。䑑，古文从臣。」《廣韻．屋韻》：「僕，侍從人也。」《書．冏命》：「其侍御僕從，罔匪正人。」白居易〈續古詩十首〉之七：「豪家多婢僕」。 另參見「 妾 」、「 童 」。

" Qi" (Ji-shaped) was later transformed into " Zhe", hands moved under the " Xin" shape, the human body changed to the left side, and the " Xin" shape became " 丵" shape, " 丵" and " servant" sound the same. It is the sound symbol of " servant". The characters of the Warring States Period were written from the " Chen", which has the same shape as the ancient characters of "Shuowen". Liu Xinglong believes that " tail" is insulting. Oracle is used as the name of a person or place. Jinwen means servants, servants, against the clock: "Servants, servants (servants), servants and concubines." Also used as official name, Jingxi: "Wang Mingjing 𤔲 shoots the palace, and the boy submisses the servants to learn to shoot. ." It is also known as " attachment", five years of Yan Shenggui: "Servant Yong Tutian", "Poetry. Lu Song.閟宫": "The mountains and rivers of tin, the vassals of Tutian". It is also used as a person's name, Shi Puhu: "Shi Puzha (as) a Zunhu." Warring States bamboo " servant" as though through " Park", "Guodian Jane. "Lao Zi Jia" Jane 2: "See Suo (Su) Guardian", the current edition of "Lao Zi" is "See Su Baopu". "Said Wen": "Servant, giver. From the person to the 萐, the 萐 also sounds. Yu, the ancient text is from the minister." "Guang Yun. "House Rhyme": "Servant, attendant." "Book.冏明": "It serves the imperial servants, the bandits are righteous." The seventh of Bai Juyi's "Ten Ancient Poems Continued": "Many servants of the rich family". See also " concubine", " child".

僕字的基本解释

僕
pú
见“仆2”。

僕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pú］
［《廣韻》蒲木切，入屋，並。］
［《廣韻》蒲沃切，入沃，並。］
“仆2”的繁体字。
(1)古代的一种奴隶。
(2)泛指供役使的仆人。
(3)驾车的人。
(4)指驾车。
(5)自称的谦词。
(6)附着。
(7)见“僕遬”。
(8)见“僕僕”。
(9)通“服”。参见“僕牛”。
(10)古代官名。
(11)姓。汉有僕黥。见《史记·惠景间侯者年表》。

僕字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　僕； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页116第18
〔古文〕䑑【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?蒲沃切，蓬入聲。【說文】給事者。【禮·禮運】仕于公曰臣，仕于家曰僕。【周禮·春官】車僕掌戎路。廣車，闕車，苹車，輕車之萃。【註】車僕，主供副車者。僕猶御也，萃猶副也。謂供副車，以待乏用也。五車皆兵車也。又司僕，官名。【五代史·百官志】唐龍朔中，改太保曰司馭，又改爲司僕。齊職儀衆僕之長曰太僕，掌輿馬。明制有太僕寺。　又御車曰僕。【論語】冉有僕。　又僕隷，賤役。【左傳·僖二十四年】秦伯送衞于晉三千人，實紀綱之僕。　又自謙之辭。【前漢·韋玄成傳】自稱爲僕，?辭也。　又辱也。【戰國策】傳命僕官。　又徒也。【莊子·則陽篇】仲尼曰：是聖人僕也。【註】猶言聖人之徒也。　又僕僕，煩猥貌。　又附也。【詩·大雅】君子萬年，景命有僕。　又隱也。【左傳·昭七年】楚芋尹無宇曰：吾先君文王，作僕區之法，曰：盜所隱器，與盜同罪。【註】僕區，?書名。區，匿也，作爲隱匿亡人之法。　又虎僕，獸名。【博物志】羽民國有獸，文似豹，名虎僕，毛可爲筆。　

僕字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
僕字的起名意思

暂无。

The traditional characters of "servant 2".
(1) A kind of slave in ancient times.
(2) Refers generally to servants of servicemen.
(3) People who drive.
(4) Refers to driving.
(5) Self-proclaimed modest words.
(6) Attachment.

(9) Through "service". See "Servant Cow".
(10) Ancient official names.
(11) Last name. Han has servant tattoos. See "Historical Records · The Chronology of Hui Jing Jianhou".

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　Pu; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 116 Page 18
〔古文〕䑑【Tang Yun】【Ji Yun】【Rhyme Meeting】? Pu Woqie, Peng enters the sound. 【Said the text】To the person who gives the person. 【Rite·Rite Fortune】To serve as a minister is a minister, and to serve as a servant as a servant. [Zhou Li·Chun Guan] The servants of the car are in charge of Rong Road. Guangche, Queche, Pingche, Light Car. [Note] The car servant, the main provider and deputy car. The servant is Yu Yu, the Cui Yu is also the deputy. Said for the deputy car, waiting for the useless. All five vehicles are soldiers. Also servant, official name. [The History of the Five Dynasties·Hundred Officials] In Tang Longshuo, the Taibao was changed to Si Yu, and then it was changed to Si Pu. The long of the servants of Qi Zhiyi is called Taipu, who is in charge of horses. There is Taipu Temple in Ming Dynasty.　The royal car and the servant. [The Analects] Ran Youpu.　Slave again, low slave. [Twenty-four years of Zuo Zhuan·Xi] Qin Bo sent 3,000 Wei Wei to Jin, the servant of Shi Ji Gang.　A word of self-humility again. [Previous Han Wei Xuancheng Biography] Claiming to be a servant, but also a divorce.　Insult again. [Warring States Policy] Passing to the servants.　It's a silly person. [Zhuangzi·Zeyang Chapter] Zhong Ni said: It is the servant of the saint. [Note] It is still a saint.　You are servant again, annoying your appearance.　 It is attached again. 【Poetry·Daya】A gentleman has a servant for ten thousand years.　Hidden again. [Zuo Zhuan·Seventh year of Zhao] Chu Yu Yin Wuyu said: I was the king of the king, and the law of the servant district, said: stealing hidden objects is the same crime as stealing. [Note] Servant area, the title of the book. District, concealment, as a method of concealing the dead.　Tiger servant again, the name of the beast. [Natural History] Yu Ming is a national animal, whose writing resembles a leopard, and its name is tiger servant, whose hair can be used as a pen.

pú
вм. 仆 (слуга, раб)
Radicals: ｲ, 業  (leader, business)
Meaning Mnemonic
A leader of business? Ha! That's me! That's I!
This version of I is more boyish. It's a sort of young man/boy way of saying "I," though you'll hear women use it too sometimes (it's a teensy bit tomboyish though).
Reading Mnemonic
You use the word I a lot. You say it so much, you just start referring to yourself with the french beaucoup (ぼく) for a lot. Because you love yourself a lot.
I am beaucoup I am. (Is that a pun? Did I do it right?) I dunno. Just say ぼく a lot and try to connect all of your approximate knowledges of languages together. Merci ぼく from ぼく.
